articles.content:
Japanese authorities' attitude condemned
   Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- At the 55th Meeting of the UN Commission on Human Rights held in Geneva on April 14 delegates of international non-governmental organizations denounced the Japanese authorities for evading state  responsibility and compensation for the criminal use of "comfort women for the army."   A delegate of the  International Fellowship for Reconciliation said  the Japanese authorities refused to admit their past crimes and  that Japan's use of sex slaves for the army was  a typical state-sponsored assault on women.   A delegate of the Asian Council of  Women's Human Rights appealed to the governments of all countries and international non-governmental organizations to make joint efforts to pressurize  the Japanese government into admitting its past crimes and implementing international recommendations in this regard.

articles.content:
Greetings to President of Togo 
   Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on April 27 sent a message of greetings to Gnassingbe Eyadema, President of Togo, on its 39th Independence Day.   The message expressed the confidence that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further strengthen and develop and wished the President bigger success in his work for the national unity and the country's prosperity.
